intro: Magnolia persuaveolens subsp. rigida, commonly known as the rigid magnolia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring before the leaves emerge. The leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a smooth margin, while the bark is gray and fissured. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. The subspecies is distinguished by its more rigid, upright growth habit compared to other magnolia species.
